instruction:
Language Arts

This section of the test contains multiple-choice questions, which you must answer by using your computer mouse to select the correct response. Upon answering a question, you can go to the next question by clicking the Next button on the Menu bar.

During this section of the test, if you choose you may skip an item and then later return to that item.

When you are finished, select Submit from the Menu bar. Your Test Administrator may have set a time limit for this test section. If there is a time limit, you will be told how much time you have. If a time limit has been set for this section of the test, you will notice a countdown timer on the Header of the screen, showing the amount of time remaining to complete this section of the test.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: Robert liked to read on Thursdays; he always took the time to do it.
Robert liked to read on Thursdays; He always took the time to do it.
Robert liked to read on thursdays; he always took the time to do it.
Robert liked to read on thursdays; He always took the time to do it.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: Henderson and Jones have taken the Greyhound bus to Toledo for a film festival.
Henderson and Jones have taken the Greyhound bus to Toledo for a Film Festival.
Henderson and Jones have taken the greyhound bus to Toledo for a Film festival.
Henderson and Jones have taken the greyhound bus to Toledo for a film festival.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: We heard that doctor Williams will give us the results later today.
We heard that doctor williams will give us the results later today.
We heard that Doctor Williams will give us the results later Today.
We heard that Doctor Williams will give us the results later today.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: Dean Williams, Head Surgeon at Somerset Hospital, will perform the operation.
Dean Williams, Head Surgeon at somerset hospital, will perform the operation.
Dean Williams, head surgeon at somerset hospital, will perform the operation.
Dean Williams, head surgeon at Somerset Hospital, will perform the operation.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: Excuse me nurse, would you tell me where to find Steve Arneson?
Excuse me Nurse, would you tell me where to find Steve Arneson?
Excuse me nurse, would you tell me where to find steve arneson?
Excuse me Nurse, would you tell me where to find steve Arneson?

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: Mr. Shepherd, have you read A Tale Of Two Cities ?
Mr. shepherd, have you read A Tale of Two Cities ?
Mr. Shepherd, have you read A Tale of Two Cities ?
Mr. Shepherd, have you read a Tale of Two Cities ?

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: Honestly, Director Martin should read that article that Jan sent via e-mail yesterday
Honestly, director Martin should read that article that Jan sent via e-mail yesterday
Honestly, Director Martin should read that article that Jan sent via E-mail yesterday
Honestly, director Martin should read that article that Jan sent via E-Mail yesterday

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in the parentheses best fills in the blank?

Steve (save) ____ those documents in his directory last week.

options.text: saves
save
saving
saved

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in the parentheses best fills in the blank?

Last Thursday Miriam (bring) ____ us a new case to evaluate.

options.text: bring
bringing
brought
brings

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in the parentheses best fills in the blank?

Please be quiet. John is (work) ___.

options.text: works
worked
work
working

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in parenthesis best fills in the blank?

The child was so excited to get the new toy that he was (jump) _________ up and down.

options.text: jumps
jumped
jumping
jump

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in parenthesis best fills in the blank?

He (lie) _____________ to the judge and the attorney to get out of jury duty last time.

options.text: lie
lied
lying
lies

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in parenthesis best fills in the blank?

Although the new employee is very capable, she may have (bite) _________ off more than she can chew.

options.text: bites
bite
bitten
biting

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in parenthesis best fills in the blank?

Make sure the patient (take) _____________ the medicine at the appropriate time.

options.text: take
took
taking
taken

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in parenthesis best fills in the blank?

We will be (film) ____________ tomorrow's show in front of a live studio audience.

options.text: filming
films
film
filmed

questions.questionText: Which of the following punctuation marks is used to separate words that are listed in sequence.

options.text: A forward slash
A period
A comma
An apostrophe

questions.questionText: Which of the following punctuation marks is used to replace the word "or" or "per" within a sentence?

options.text: A period
An ellipsis
A hyphen
A forward slash

questions.questionText: Which of the following punctuation marks is used to end a sentence that conveys extreme emotions?

options.text: A question mark
An exclamation point
A period
A colon

questions.questionText: Which of the following punctuation marks is used in a contraction?

options.text: Quotation marks
An apostrophe
A semicolon
A period

questions.questionText: Which of the following punctuation marks is used before a list of items in which each item appears on its own line in a passage?

options.text: A semicolon
A colon
A hyphen
A forward slash

questions.questionText: In which of the following sentences are commas used correctly?

options.text: People who believe government should be more transparent recently held a rally in Washington. (no commas)
People who believe government should be more transparent, recently, held a rally in Washington.
People who believe government should be more transparent recently, held a rally in Washington.
People, who believe government should be more transparent, recently held a rally in Washington.

questions.questionText: In which of the following sentences are commas used correctly?

options.text: Sacramento, which is one of the most diverse cities in the world is the state capitol of California.
Sacramento which is one of the most diverse cities in the world, is the state capitol of California.
Sacramento which is one of the most diverse cities in the world is the state capitol of California. (no commas)
Sacramento, which is one of the most diverse cities in the world, is the state capitol of California.

questions.questionText: In which of the following sentences are commas used correctly?

options.text: My dog who won't leave the cat alone, fell into the pool.
My dog, who won't leave the cat alone, fell into the pool.
My dog, who won't leave the cat alone fell into the pool.
My dog who won't leave the cat alone fell into the pool. (no commas)

questions.questionText: In which of the following sentences are commas used correctly?

options.text: Individuals without form 32-a, even those without the need to report extenuating circumstances, will need to report to building 7 immediately.
Individuals without form 32-a, even those without the need to report extenuating circumstances will need to report to building 7 immediately.
Individuals without form 32-a even those without the need to report extenuating circumstances, will need to report to building 7 immediately.
Individuals without form 32-a, even those without the need to report extenuating circumstances, will need to report to building 7, immediately.

questions.questionText: In which of the following sentences are commas used correctly?

options.text: While many people may believe this to be the case our firm was not responsible for the actions occurring on May 5 2003.
While many people may believe this to be the case, our firm was not responsible for the actions occurring on May 5 2003.
While many people may believe this to be the case our firm was not responsible for the actions occurring on May 5, 2003.
While many people may believe this to be the case, our firm was not responsible for the actions occurring on May 5, 2003.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences should be connected with a semi-colon?

options.text: Our company needs payment for the following invoices ___ A17, B32, and C91.
Filing may be boring for many people __ however, I find it relaxing.
Paris has so many great attractions ____ the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower, and many more.
We took our clothes to the cleaners ___ and then we went to the bank.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences should be connected with a semi-colon?

options.text: Please bring the ingredients ____ cinnamon, vanilla, sugar, and salt.
The ride to the top of the hill was long ___ but we made it would any problems.
I don't remember the last time I went to the train station ___ last May perhaps.
These headphones have excellent reviews ___ I think I'll buy them.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences should be connected with a semi-colon?

options.text: Medicine often makes me drowsy ___ I think I'll take a nap.
They tried to keep us from seeing the truth ____ but we did anyway.
Mark couldn't find his way to the meeting ___ so he went back to his desk.
Robert needed a few things to finish his report ___ data, charts, and tables.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences should be connected with a colon?

options.text: Please bring the required items ___ pens, papers, and books.
When the cat is away ___ the mice will play.
Bob was quoted saying ___ "There will be cake".
Jane, starting next week ___ will be the new team lead.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences should be connected with a colon?

options.text: I like candy ___ but have a toothache.
The earth has limited resources ___ They will eventually all be used up.
The temperature is hot ___ but there is a slight breeze.
When the going gets tough ___ the tough get tougher.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a complete sentence?

options.text: Wednesday night.
Monday or Tuesday?
Take the for today.
Today is Friday.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a complete sentence?

options.text: Are you in the?
For many days.
Two in one.
Where are you?

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a complete sentence?

options.text: Pick up the kids after work.
Carrots and grapes in fridge.
Many messages left in voicemail.
Take garbage to dump.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a complete sentence?

options.text: Excuse me.
Hand the book to.
Fish and chips.
To find an answer.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a complete sentence?

options.text: Running errands all over town.
And stay out of the kitchen.
The contract will last two years.
Finding the true path.

questions.questionText:
Which of the following changes to the sentence fragment below would make it a complete sentence?

Doing math homework.

options.text: I doing math homework for hours.
Doing math homework until early morning.
The child is doing math homework.
The sentence is correct as is.

questions.questionText:
Which of the following changes to the sentence fragment below would make it a complete sentence?

Making plans.

options.text: Making plans to go shopping.
We will be making plans for the holidays.
Jeff making plans with John.
The sentence is correct as is.

questions.questionText:
Which of the following changes to the sentence fragment below would make it a complete sentence?

There are two dogs.

options.text: Where are two dogs?
Think there are two dogs.
Are two dogs.
The sentence is correct as is.

questions.questionText:
The following sentence is a "run-on sentence." Which of the changes below would correct the problem?

There is a solution, this is it.

options.text: There is a solution this is it.
There is a solution, and this is it.
This is it, there is a solution.
There it is, this solution.

questions.questionText:
The following sentence is a "run-on sentence." Which of the changes below would correct the problem?

There are not enough days to complete the project I will have to do it at home.

options.text: There are not enough days to complete the project - I will have to do it at home.
There are not enough days to complete the project; I will have to do it at home.
There are not enough days to complete the project, I will have to do it at home.
The sentence is correct as is.

questions.questionText:
Fill in the blank with the correct plural or possessive form of the word.

My ________ home has five rooms.

options.text: families
family's
families'
familys

questions.questionText:
Fill in the blank with the correct plural or possessive form of the word.

The park ________ retrieved the picnic basket.

options.text: ranger's
rangers'
rangers
rangeres

questions.questionText:
Fill in the blank with the correct plural or possessive form of the word.

Do not touch _____ property without permission.

options.text: others
others'
other's
other

questions.questionText:
Fill in the blank with the correct plural or possessive form of the word.

Stack all of the ________ in the cupboard.

options.text: dishes'
dish's
dishs
dishes

questions.questionText:
Fill in the blank with the correct plural or possessive form of the word.

The Humane __________ dinner for disabled animals is this week.

options.text: Society's
Societies'
Societies
Societys

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences does NOT contain a misspelling or incorrectly used word?

options.text: You're dog was spotted down the street.
Its unfortunate that we can't visit the zoo.
Everyone in this city spends nine months out of the year complaining about the whether.
During the spring, Tim was badly affected by the pollen in the air.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences does NOT contain a misspelling or incorrectly used word?

options.text: The add was not honest regarding the abilities of the product.
The copier is on its forth toner cartridge.
He wore a coat and hat.
Its my fifth year working for the company.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences does NOT contain a misspelling or incorrectly used word?

options.text: The passed does not necessarily determine the present.
Street vendors must not pedal their wares at this corner.
John's presents was missed at the last meeting.
I will have to cite you for improper parking.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences does NOT contain a misspelling or incorrectly used word?

options.text: The article claims that the politician prays on his constituents' fears.
Their large bank account is the reason that they're hesitant to help pay taxes.
The athlete won a meddle for his efforts.
I don't sea a problem with your report.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences does NOT contain a misspelling or incorrectly used word?

options.text: You may go to the meeting if you wish, but I don't plan to.
The law states that you are forbidden to insight others to violence.
Your not going to leave the office yet are you?
I would like too visit the museum at some point.
